qas.question: What is the most commonly abused substance during adolescent years in the U.S.?
Aside from alcohol, what is the most commonly indulged drug habit during adolescent years?
The heightened usage of what drug is most likely due at least in some part to the rising popularity of rave culture?
From the late 1990s to mid 2000s, was drug use in teens on the rise or decline?

context: Following a steady <a3_0>decline<a3_0/>, beginning in the late 1990s up through the mid-2000s, illicit drug use among adolescents has been on the rise in the U.S. Aside from <a0_0>alcohol<a0_0/>, <a1_0>marijuana<a1_0/> is the most commonly indulged drug habit during adolescent years. Data collected by the National Institute on Drug Abuse shows that between the years of 2007 and 2011, marijuana use grew from 5.7% to 7.2% among 8th grade students; among 10th grade students, from 14.2% to 17.6%; and among 12th graders, from 18.8% to 22.6%. Additional, recent years have seen a surge in popularity of MDMA; between 2010 and 2011, the use of MDMA increased from 1.4% to 2.3% among high school seniors. The heightened usage of <a2_0>ecstasy<a2_0/> most likely ties in at least to some degree with the rising popularity of rave culture.
